ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sensorineural hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Bilateral hearing loss (mild-to-severe right, slight-to-moderate left) consistent with history of radiation therapy to the neck.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Functional overlay
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Initial testing showed PTA thresholds 20 dB poorer than SRT; valid organic thresholds were obtained only after reinstruction.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Tinnitus and Hyperacusis
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient reports ringing and sensitivity to loud, high-pitched sounds in the right ear starting after radiation therapy.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine hearing thresholds and configuration of loss.
To assess speech reception and recognition and cross-check pure-tone thresholds for reliability.
To assess the acoustic reflex arc and check for retrocochlear pathology.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Testing revealed bilateral sensorineural hearing loss, mild-to-severe in the right ear and slight-to-moderate in the left, likely related to prior radiation. Initial results showed functional overlay (PTA-SRT discrepancy) which resolved after reinstruction. Word recognition was excellent. Middle ear function was normal.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Mild SNHL (250-3000 Hz) sloping to severe at 8000 Hz (PTA 33 dB HL). Left ear: Slight sloping to mild SNHL with 3000 Hz notch (PTA 27 dB HL). Initial functional overlay (20 dB discrepancy) resolved with reinstruction.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT (RE 30 dB HL, LE 20 dB HL) in agreement with valid PTA. WRS excellent (RE 92%, LE 96%).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Present and normal ipsilaterally and contralaterally at 500-2000 Hz; absent at 4000 Hz. Reflex decay negative at 500 and 1000 Hz.

proposed_items: Annual hearing testing to monitor sensitivity
Use hearing protection when exposed to noise
Evaluation for management options for tinnitus and hyperacusis
Evaluation for use of amplification and HAT (Hearing Assistive Technology)
counseling_actions: Reinstruction regarding test procedures to resolve functional overlay

escalation.rationale_short: Referral to otologist recommended given medical history of radiation and hearing loss.
